Detailed Description

Header file that exposes the protected interface of the bgpstream elem generator.

Author
Alistair King

Definition in file bgpstream_elem_generator.h.

Parameters
generatorpointer to the generator to clear

Definition at line 709 of file bgpstream_elem_generator.c.

Referenced by bgpstream_record_clear().

bgpstream_elem_generator_t* bgpstream_elem_generator_create ( )

Create a new Elem generator.

Returns
pointer to a new Elem generator instance

Currently the elem generator is simply a reusable container for elem records (populated by a call to bgpstream_elem_populate_generator), but it is possible that at some point in the future it may actually generate elem records on the fly.

bgpstream_elem_t* bgpstream_elem_generator_get_next_elem ( bgpstream_elem_generator_t *  generator)

Get the next elem from the generator.

Parameters
generatorpointer to the generator to retrieve an elem from
Returns
borrowed pointer to the next elem
Note
the memory for the returned elem belongs to the generator.

int bgpstream_elem_generator_populate ( bgpstream_elem_generator_t *  generator,
struct struct_bgpstream_record_t *  record 
)

Populate a generator with elems from the given record.

Parameters
generatorpointer to the generator to populate
recordpointer to a BGP Stream Record instance
Returns
0 if the generator was populated successfully, -1 otherwise
Note
This function may defer processing of the record until each call to bgpstream_elem_generator_next_elem
